attributes.action: Training for UK Police in Managing Medical Cannabis Prescriptions and Patients
attributes.additional_details: We firmly believe that a concerted effort to rectify these issues will usher in a more compassionate, informed, and equitable approach to medical cannabis in the United Kingdom. In so doing, we will enhance the lives of patients who rely on these prescriptions. We beseech the UK Parliament to accord this matter the priority it deserves and to champion a solution that safeguards patients' rights and well-being.
attributes.background: We respectfully implore the UK Parliament to take immediate and diligent action to address this multifaceted issue by advancing the education and training of police officers nationwide in matters pertaining to legal medical cannabis prescriptions and patients.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The police are not responsible for patient care or prescriptions for medical cannabis, so we're not sure exactly what you want the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
